channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Workers from different outlets have been brought in to staff the reopened Fawkner store, but they have been told not to work at their original stores to ensure any new coronavirus cases do not spread.
item.title: Worksafe inquiries after new Fawkner McDonald's staff told not to work at other stores

item.description: American Anthony Smith took a moment to hand the referee a tooth during his defeat to Brazilian veteran Glover Teixeira.
item.title: 'My teeth are falling out': UFC fighter cops battering

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australian unemployment rate at 6.2 per cent as global COVID-19 cases top 4.3 million, nation's death toll stands at 98

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Nearly 600,000 Australians lose their job; Sutton concedes Cedar Meats outbreak could have been handled differently

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Australia’s most prolific paedophile priest's time in jail was increased on Thursday after he was sentenced for more sexual abuse of boys in western Victoria.
item.title: More jail time means Gerald Ridsdale is 'likely to die in custody'

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The supercoach has long been a fan of the game's new six-again rule, but denies assertions he had anything to do with it being rushed through.
item.title: Wayne Bennett denies he played any role in NRL rule changes

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: NBN Co boss Stephen Rue says the company will take its time to decide how to best use the extra $4.1 billion raised from the markets as third quarter revenue ticks over $2.8 billion.
item.title: NBN Co in no rush to use extra funds on network upgrades

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland's unemployment rate jumped to 6.8 per cent last month after the state's economy lost 129,500 workers during the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: 'Nobody alive has ever seen this': 129,500 Queenslanders lose jobs

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: The mortgage broker accused of taunting a dying policewoman in the aftermath of the Eastern Freeway crash in which four officers were killed has been denied bail.
item.title: 'Unacceptable risk': Porsche driver Richard Pusey refused bail

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: The clash of Dawn Passage, Rocha Clock, Bandersnatch and Masked Crusader at Rosehill on Saturday has all camps excited.
item.title: No masking confidence of Guineas contenders as vintage showdown looms

item.description: New Zealand's government plans to borrow and spend vast amounts of money as it tries to keep unemployment below 10 per cent in the wake of the pandemic.
item.title: New Zealand borrows big and spends hard to counter job losses

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: What is the new syndrome in children that's linked to COVID-19? And what effects has COVID-19 had on Australian children so far?
item.title: How does COVID-19 affect children (and what is Kawasaki disease)?

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Twin tunnels will be dug to run trains from Roma Street to Woolloongabba, underneath the Brisbane River.
item.title: Tunnelling has begun for Brisbane's new underground railway

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Health authorities will look at the deaths of people who had earlier recovered from COVID-19 to determine if the virus could have been a contributing factor.
item.title: NSW Health to examine deaths of people deemed to have recovered from COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Victoria Cross recipient Ben Roberts-Smith pushes back against a move to gag parts of his defamation trial, as he wants to tell his story in an open court.
item.title: Ben Roberts-Smith fights for right to tell his story in open court

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin's administrators have proposed the airline buy a fleet of long-range Boeing Dreamliner 787 aircraft, but prospective buyers are concerned the plan ignores the impact of the pandemic.
item.title: Virgin Australia plan for Dreamliner fleet fuels bidder disquiet

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: North American correspondent Matthew Knott joins national editor Tory Maguire to discuss the latest in the US where over 84,000 people have died from COVID-19.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: Trump just got more Trump

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The jobs market is going to get even worse. The Morrison government has to move quicker to support Australians back into work.
item.title: Jobless queues will grow without direct help

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: Bette Prange doesn't exactly know how she's going to reintroduce students to her school in a couple of weeks. But she knows that preps don't need Mum or Dad to walk them inside.
item.title: Never mind the kids, separation anxiety looms for parents as preps return to school

item.description: Australian sports stars Joe and Renae Ingles are shooting for three.
item.title: Joe and Renae Ingles expecting again

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: ME Bank first noticed there was a problem with its redraw facilities in November last year but only told customers days before it was restricted.
item.title: ME Bank defends dividend policy, admits redraw changes were flagged in November

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The AFL is likely to send Adelaide and Port Adelaide to Queensland hubs with West Coast and Fremantle, to overcome training or border restrictions and restart the season.
item.title: Four AFL teams likely headed to Queensland to restart season

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: Fans can tune in and watch a reunion they've been waiting a decade to see.
item.title: Powderfinger gets the band back together

item.description: When I think back to pre-coronavirus office life, it almost seems designed to spread germs. We clearly need to do better in the post-lockdown future. But how?
item.title: Open plan offices will survive this pandemic. Here's why.

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Fituese will look to take the next step towards fulfilling her potential in Saturday's Denise's Joy Stakes at Rosehill.
item.title: Thompson has the perfect Fituese for black-type joy

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The Minister for Customer Service Victor Dominello has ordered a review into the matter by the Auditor-General.
item.title: Service NSW emails hacked: customers' information accessed

item.description: Plant-based milks like soy, almond or oat milk are easy to make. And, they can help you cut down your personal carbon footprint.
item.title: How to make your own plant-based milk (without any fancy equipment)

item.description: Two-times grand slam champion Naomi Osaka is using the novel coronavirus shutdown as one of self reflection to try and overcome her crippling shyness.
item.title: Naomi Osaka using lockdown to conquer inner demons

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Caltex says the pain from the coronavirus-driven collapse in demand has become even more acute as traders turn to ships to store the crude oil nobody is buying.
item.title: Virus crisis worsens for Caltex as ships store oil glut out at sea

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: West Coast and Fremantle will be allowed full-contact AFL training in WA before likely being relocated to the Gold Coast.
item.title: WA Premier takes a swipe at 'pampered' Vics as Eagles, Dockers get OK to train

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Villers-Bretonneux mayor Patrick Simon was furthering the town's special bond with Australia just weeks before falling ill.
item.title: Australia's best friend in France dies from coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: The newly ASX-listed maltster has kicked off a capital raising just weeks after it was spun out of GrainCorp to boost its balance sheet in the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: United Malt taps investors for $165m as beer sales suffer in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state moves to take a stake in Virgin and pubs, clubs and beauty salons prepare to reopen

item.description: US scientists remain unsure whether the virus can spread from people to cats and then back to people.
item.title: Pet carriers: Coronavirus spreads between cats, study shows

item.description: Sydney Swans coach John Longmire has labelled suggestions AFL gameplay will improve because of forced cuts to football departments as "naive".
item.title: Sydney coach Longmire slams football department critics

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The Queensland government has not ruled out throwing more taxpayer money towards resurrecting collapsed Virgin Australia in order to "fend off" interest from other states.
item.title: Queensland may throw more money at Virgin to 'fend off' other states

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: Premier Mark McGowan's jobs growth promises have been trashed by the global coronavirus pandemic, with government restrictions on economic activity pushing WA's unemployment rate to 6 per cent.
item.title: WA Labor cans job targets, promises as unemployment returns to 2017 levels

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Dyslexic has been the 'nearly' horse and Brent Stanley is hoping to put that unwanted moniker behind him in Saturday's Dark Jewel Classic.
item.title: Frustration of being Dyslexic set to end in Dark Jewel Classic

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: You can catch live performances by Archie Roach, Tim Minchin, Tones and I and many more this weekend.
item.title: Host of local talent home delivered

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Official figures on employment are out but a series of factors cloud the true state of the jobs market. Why?
item.title: Unemployment figures are bad. Here's why the reality is worse

item.description: West Coast and Fremantle will be allowed full contact AFL training in Western Australia before relocating to a Queensland-based quarantine hub.
item.title: Government clears WA clubs for full AFL training

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: Minister of Education Sue Ellery says attending school is mandatory except for those who have an exemption for medical reasons.
item.title: Compulsory schooling to resume in WA for Catholic and state schools

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Phaistos and Live And Free look to be the biggest beneficiaries following the likely scratching of favourite Archedemus from Friday's Scone Cup.
item.title: Phaistos and Live And Free to battle for Scone Cup favouritism

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Former Australia managing director and intended President of Americas Angus McPherson quietly left the group in February.
item.title: Treasury Wine hires heavy hitter as executive exodus continues

item.description: The restart of the Premier League season is expected to be pushed back by at least seven days from June 12 to June 19, after players and managers expressed their concerns that major questions needed to be answered over the risks of a return to full-contact training and games resuming.
item.title: Premier League restart date set to be pushed back

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: Locked down and isolated, the show must go on for five Sydney women.
item.title: Locked-down circus performers bouncing off the walls

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Stephanie Kukulka lost her communications manager job because of the coronavirus pandemic, and says she has only just moved past the "anger" stage of the grief cycle.
item.title: Seeking security: COVID-19 job victims navigate a world of record unemployment

item.description: England pace bowler Jofra Archer has suggested artificial crowd noise should be played at grounds to help create an atmosphere during behind-closed-doors matches this summer.
item.title: Archer calls for artificial crowd noise in cricket

item.description: I am looking primarily for comfort in eating these days, for unabashed deliciousness, and this dish provides it in spades.
item.title: Celebrating the great Australian tradition of meat in a box
